_sText:
Ancient Arctic Ruins - Hostage Rescue 

Description:
------------
In a cold and snow filled valley are the ancient ruins of a lost civilization.  The strong winds 
howl around people who trespass on these hallowed grounds.  Some terrorists have 
captured some prominent scientists and are try to extort large sums of money for their safe return.

Objective:
------------
CT Team: Move swiftly to the other side of the map & enter the ancient mountain fortress to rescue the hostages from their jail cells. Then take them safely to the "Knight's Temple" or "Alter of Time".
Terrorists: Your objective is to keep the CT team out of your fortress.  Kill them all!
Note: This map has 6 medical boxes & the "Alter of Time" which will heal you. They respawn after 75 seconds.

Title			: Ancient Arctic Ruins
Author			: Redclaw
Release Date		: August 6, 2008
File name		: cs_ancient_arctic_ruins_v1.bsp 
IM/Email Address	: tachyonrays@hotmail.com
Website			: http://home.comcast.net/~redclaws/
Max Players		: (32) 16 vs. 16

Intro
------------
By way of introduction, I am "Redclaw" and I have spent the last 4 years mapping for AVP2. I also served as a map reviewer for PlanetAVP. 
About 6 months ago I jumped in the Half Life 2 and CounterStrike arena feet first. It's been a total blast and I love the HL2 world. 
If play AVP2 and would like to check out those maps please PM me.

Installation
------------

Unzip the files cs_ancient_arctic_ruins_v1.bsp:
Steam\Steamapps\<>\counter-strike source\cstrike\maps\

WARNING
------------
Changing the map name from "cs_ancient_arctic_ruins_v1.bsp" to anything else will cause
all the special visual effects (specularity) to stop working as the cubemaps have been compiled 
for this map filename only. Basically the map will look like crap if you change it's name.

Thanks:			: Chizbone for suggestions & pointers on the NAV mesh, & all the people that give me feedback on my maps.


Other Notes:
------------

Please feel free to email me (tachyonrays@hotmail.com) with suggestions and bugs you might find in my maps.

I run a dedicated server called "Redclaws Dedicated Source Server", please come join anytime.
